meanings.definition: Give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will impower the students to lead the class discussion.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to impower her team with decision-making abilities.
meanings.sent3: The magician impowered the rabbit to perform card tricks.
meanings.sent4: The superhero's cape seemed to impower him with incredible strength.
meanings.sent5: The ancient amulet had the ability to impower its wearer with wisdom and courage.

meanings.sent1: The king will impower his loyal knight with the title of Duke.
meanings.sent2: The company CEO impowered the new executive with the responsibility of leading the project.
meanings.sent3: The wizard impowered the talking parrot with the ability to grant wishes.
meanings.sent4: The crown seemed to impower the queen with an aura of majesty and grace.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was said to impower whoever possessed it with great influence and respect.
